DataElement.preferredName: Patient Uterine Carcinosarcoma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of stage grouping related to an assessment based on the combined evaluation of a patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage of A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the uterine corpus and less often the cervix, as a means to determine whether a patient/participant is suitable for enrollment in a study according to protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Uterine Carcinosarcoma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment based on the combined evaluation of a patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage of A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the uterine corpus and less often the cervix, as a means to determine whether a patient/participant is suitable for enrollment in a study according to protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Uterine Carcinosarcoma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the uterine corpus and less often the cervix.  It is characterized by the presence of two components: a malignant epithelial component and a sarcomatous component.  In the uterine corpus the epithelial component is usually glandular whereas in the cervix is usually non-glandular.  Carcinosarcoma of the cervix, although it is aggressive, it may have a better prognosis compared to the uterine corpus carcinosarcoma.:Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR):Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the uterine corpus and less often the cervix.  It is characterized by the presence of two components: a malignant epithelial component and a sarcomatous component.  In the uterine corpus the epithelial component is usually glandular whereas in the cervix is usually non-glandular.  Carcinosarcoma of the cervix, although it is aggressive, it may have a better prognosis compared to the uterine corpus carcinosarcoma.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Uterine Carcinosarcoma Stage Grouping Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of stage grouping of a usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the uterine corpus and less often the cervix used to determine a patient/participant's eligibility to participate on a clinical trial.
